content: I just realized I should probably introduce myself properly now that I'm making PRs :-) I'm an assistant prof in CS at the University of Montreal, working in quantum information theory. I don't know anything about formal verification despite being in CS however, so I guess here that makes me some sort of very applied mathematician.
Ah! I thought your name sounded familiar --- I've used your entropy accumulation stuff before
or, rather, Thomas used it and I only kind of understood it
Yes, I remember seeing your name on the list of QIP speakers at some point I think!
:) the main theorem of the talk i gave at QIP 2018 is false
that's a big reason that I'm here
Bienvenue, Frédéric ! I'm from Warwick, Qc.
Bienvenue! Je viens de Gatineau, Qc :)
Yuck. Could somebody (-ies?) make that ugly maple leaf go away? ;) :fleur_de_lis: :fleur_de_lis: :fleur_de_lis:
Merci! En fait je travaillais au LORIA à Nancy jusqu'à récemment, j'avais entendu ton nom à plusieurs reprises :-)

@Jalex Stark, actually one of the reasons why I'm here is that the entropy accumulation paper took a solid three years to get through the refereeing process, by which time there were several other results built on top. The referees didn't find any bugs in the end, but it makes you think...
yeah there's a lot of bookkeeping there which seems like a computer really ought to be good at
Yeah, and when you take into account the amount of proofreading you have to do, formalizing the result suddenly seems a lot less time-consuming...
I'm also from Gatineau, QC, studied at Université de Montréal in CS/math and now working in Montreal
Hey! I'm PhD student at McGill University, and previously at Université de Montréal, doing mostly graph theory.
Always nice to see people from Quebec here! I'm at the CS department at the Université de Montréal.
Cool! I did my Master's with Gena Hahn at DIRO actually.
Hey, we might have enough people at the various Montreal universities to have a gathering this summer!
Also from Montreal here, I am an undergrad at McGill with interests in Lean! :grinning:
I'd be up for it!
How about this Wednesday (July 6) at 5pm, walking up Mount Royal, starting at the Peel steps? React with :+1: if that works, or :time: if you'd rather a different day/time
I would have liked to join! But I am in Europe at the moment for a few weeks. But definitely would be happy to meet in the future.
I'm feeling sick since yesterday, so I won't be walking up the Mount after all, but I encourage others to do it! And I'm sure we'll do another walk later in the summer
We can also just reschedule to next week.
Next week I'll be at ICERM for the Lean workshop, so I wouldn't be able to join...
So are we still on for this...?
I think no. At least, I made other plans.
Next time!
yes!
Should we try doing this next week?
Next week it's my turn to be away -- I'll be back the week after though and would be available then.
Both weeks work for me, ideally on a Wednesday or Thursday

Alright, let's try again :smile: How about this coming Monday, Aug 8, at 5pm? We'll meet at the Peel steps to walk up Mount Royal. React with :+1: if that works, or :time: if you'd rather a different day/time. I believe we may be joined by @Jake Levinson and @Peter Nelson
I won't be able to make it I'm afraid, I'll be in Israel for ITP!

Mathieu Guay-Paquet said:

Alright, let's try again :smile: How about this coming Monday, Aug 8, at 5pm? We'll meet at the Peel steps to walk up Mount Royal. React with :+1: if that works, or :time: if you'd rather a different day/time. I believe we may be joined by Jake Levinson and Peter Nelson

Backup plan in case of (likely) rain: the math building at UQAM is at the Place-des-Arts metro station (it's the beige building with a curved wall), and we can meet at the downstairs cafeteria.
See you all later today!
Yes, and given the uncertain weather let's do the backup plan, of meeting at UQAM

Next Wednesday (November 16), between 3pm and 4pm, some of us will be doing the natural number game collaboratively at UQAM in room PK-4323 (201 Avenue du Président-Kennedy). If anyone here (or anyone you know) is curious about Lean, feel free to join us!
I won't be able to make it (I'm teaching at UdeM from 4pm to 5pm), but have fun!

Mathieu Guay-Paquet said:

Next Wednesday (November 16), between 3pm and 4pm, some of us will be doing the natural number game collaboratively at UQAM in room PK-4323 (201 Avenue du Président-Kennedy). If anyone here (or anyone you know) is curious about Lean, feel free to join us!

Reminder that this is happening tomorrow!
I'll be there, and convinced a friend who's interested in Lean to come!

Let's do it again! Next Wednesday (December 14), between 3pm and 4pm, some of us will be (continuing to) do natural numbers game collaboratively at UQAM in room PK-4323 (201 Avenue du Président-Kennedy). Anyone in Montreal who's curious about Lean is welcome :smile:
@Frédéric Dupuis @Antoine Labelle sorry for cancelling :up:
No problem, get well soon!
